definition: to be famous far and wide (idiom)
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: Cantonese sausage is well known for its particular appearance and flavor.
sentences.chinese: 廣式臘腸以其獨特的外觀和風味聞名遐邇。

sentences.english: This May Day holiday, my friend and I went to climb the famous Wuyi mountain.
sentences.chinese: 今年五一，我和朋友去聞名遐邇的武夷山玩。

sentences.english: She is a Chinese TV star and famous for acting as a policewoman.
sentences.chinese: 她是一位以扮演警花而聞名遐邇的中國影星。

sentences.english: Rorty is famous for his theory of "post - philosophical culture" .
sentences.chinese: 羅蒂以他的“後哲學文化”理論而聞名遐邇。

sentences.english: The mountain is most famous for its spectacular sunrise and sunset.
sentences.chinese: 泰山的日出與日落，聞名遐邇。

sentences.english: This restaurant is celebrated for their juicy rib-eye steak.
sentences.chinese: 這家餐廳以鮮美多汁的樂野牛排而聞名遐邇。

sentences.english: Guilin is also famous for its meandering Lijiang River and Peach Blossom River.
sentences.chinese: 桂林還以蜿蜒的灕江和桃花江聞名遐邇。

sentences.english: The Tokyo Tower is world-famous, and is even known by three-year-old children.
sentences.chinese: 東京鐵塔聞名遐邇，連三歲小孩子都知道。

sentences.english: This lychee trees has become linked to the famous tree.
sentences.chinese: 這荔枝樹便成了聞名遐邇的掛綠樹。

sentences.english: Rotorua city is renowned for its unique “rotteneggs” aroma, which is caused by the geothermal activity releasingsulphur compounds into the atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 該市以其空氣中瀰漫着的“臭雞蛋”味而聞名遐邇。

sentences.english: The town is famous as a hot-spring resort.
sentences.chinese: 作爲一個溫泉勝地，這鎮子聞名遐邇。

sentences.english: the designer has built a reputation for his unusually shaped carafes.
sentences.chinese: 該設計師以其造型奇特的玻璃水瓶而聞名遐邇。

sentences.english: Elegant and Graceful, here is the famous Silk City alone.
sentences.chinese: 鍾靈毓秀，這裏是聞名遐邇的獨秀水城。
